metadata.title: CVE-2022-48924 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal: int340x: fix memory leak in int3400_notify()It is easy to hit the below memory leaks in my TigerLake platform:unreferenced object 0xffff927c8b91dbc0 (size 32):  comm "kworker/0:2", pid 112, jiffies 4294893323 (age 83.604s)  hex dump (first 32 bytes):    4e 41 4d 45 3d 49 4e 54 33 34 30 30 20 54 68 65  NAME=INT3400 The    72 6d 61 6c 00 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b 6b a5  rmal.kkkkkkkkkk.  backtrace:    [<ffffffff9c502c3e>] __kmalloc_track_caller+0x2fe/0x4a0    [<ffffffff9c7b7c15>] kvasprintf+0x65/0xd0    [<ffffffff9c7b7d6e>] kasprintf+0x4e/0x70    [<ffffffffc04cb662>] int3400_notify+0x82/0x120 [int3400_thermal]    [<ffffffff9c8b7358>] acpi_ev_notify_dispatch+0x54/0x71    [<ffffffff9c88f1a7>] acpi_os_execute_deferred+0x17/0x30    [<ffffffff9c2c2c0a>] process_one_work+0x21a/0x3f0    [<ffffffff9c2c2e2a>] worker_thread+0x4a/0x3b0    [<ffffffff9c2cb4dd>] kthread+0xfd/0x130    [<ffffffff9c201c1f>] ret_from_fork+0x1f/0x30Fix it by calling kfree() accordingly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-aws - 4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-gcp - 4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-oracle - 4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
